This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=DSBS.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-11T08:49:13Z soledad.esteban 2015-03-11T09:49:08+01:00 2015-03-11T09:49:08+01:00 Workshop on The use of Phylogenies in the Study of Macroevolution, Sep 28 Oct 2, Barcelona (Spain) https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;f255a826.1503 Dear colleagues,<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Registration is open for the course "THE USE OF PHYLOGENIES IN THE STUDY OF MACROEVOLUTION -\ufffd\ufffd 3rd edition", Septiembre 28-October 2, 2015.\ufffd\ufffdInstructor: Dr. Juan L\ufffd\ufffdpez Cantalapiedra (Museo de Ciencias Naturales, CSIC, Spain).<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>New phylogenetic methods would allow us to draw on the information encapsulated in phylogenetic trees in order to address a wide range of questions on macroevolution. First, this course will introduce participants to the use, modification and representation of phylogenetic trees. Then, we will focus on the use of phylogenetic information to reconstruct ancestral characters and biogeographic histories, learning how to apply phylogenetic comparative [...] 14th Deep-Sea Biology Symposium 2015-02-23T10:27:07+00:00 2015-02-23T10:27:07+00:00 14DSBS deadline reminder: 20th March Abstract submission https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;473be3e1.1502 Dear colleagues,<br><br>Abstract submission deadline for the 14th Deep-Sea Biology Symposium is fast approaching!<br><br>Please check our website for instructions: http://14dsbs.web.ua.pt/14dsbs/Abstract.html<br><br>Other details on registration and travel arrangements are also available.<br><br>We invite you to print the attached flyers and pass them along to your colleagues.<br><br>Look forward to seeing in Aveiro,<br><br>The organizing committee soledad.esteban 2015-02-16T09:47:38+01:00 2015-02-16T09:47:38+01:00 Workshop on Agent-Based Models in Ecology, June 15-19, Spain https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;2163d196.1502 Dear colleagues,<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Registration\ufffd\ufffdis open for the course "INTRODUCTION TO INDIVIDUAL BASED MODELS IN ECOLOGY USING NETLOGO", June 15-19, 2015.<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Instructors:\ufffd\ufffdDr. J\ufffd\ufffdrgen Groeneveld (Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd UFZ, Germany) and Dr. Alexander Singer\ufffd\ufffd(Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd UFZ, Germany).<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Site: Els Hostalets de Pierola, Barcelona, Spain.<br><br>Agent-Based Models (ABM), or Individual Based Models, are one of a class of computational models for simulating the actions and interactions of autonomous agents (both individual or collective entities such as organizations or groups) with a view to assessing their effects on the system as a whole. In this [...] Chris Yesson 2015-02-04T13:27:46+00:00 2015-02-04T13:27:46+00:00 Fwd: DSBS: possible spam from forums@PRSTATISTICS.CO.UK https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;8f028412.1502 ---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Oliver Hooker <forums@prstatistics.co.uk><br>To: <DSBS@jiscmail.ac.uk><br>Cc:<br>Date: Wed, 4 Feb 2015 13:07:38 +0000<br>Subject: Genetic data analysis using R - STATISTICS COURSE<br>Genetic data analysis using R (statistics course)<br><br>This 5 day course will be held at SCENE (Scottish Centre for Ecology and<br>the Natural Environment), Glasgow, United Kingdom from August 3rd - 7th 2015 [...] soledad.esteban 2015-02-03T10:39:20+01:00 2015-02-03T10:39:20+01:00 Biogeography workshop, June 15-19, Barcelona, Spain https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;a1877f08.1502 Dear colleague,<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>There are still some places available for the course \ufffd\ufffd"HISTORICAL BIOGEOGRAPHY: FUNDAMENTALS AND APPLICATIONS", June 15-19, 2015.<br>INSTRUCTORS: Dr.\ufffd\ufffdLone Aagesen\ufffd\ufffd(IBODA, CONICET, Argentina) and Dr. Claudia A. Szumik (Miguel Lillo Foundation, CONICET, Argentina).<br><br>PLACE:\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFacilities of the Centre of Restauraci\ufffd\ufffd i Interpretaci\ufffd\ufffd Paleontologica, Els Hostalets de Pierola,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBarcelona (Spain).<br><br>WEBPAGE AND REGISTRATION: http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/biog/historic-biogeography/<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>PROGRAM:<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Topic 1.\ufffd\ufffdHistorical Background:<br>- The connection to cladistics. Basic concepts of cladistic methods. Optimality criteria in systematics and its connection to biogeography. How to manage space.<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Topic 2. Raw Data:<br>- Distribution maps. Errors in databases. Georeferencing and how to measure the error [...] Moriaki Yasuhara 2015-01-26T16:43:32+08:00 2015-01-26T16:43:32+08:00 Fwd: Second announcement: International Conference on Biodiversity, Ecology and Conservation of Marine Ecosystems 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;46d35334.1501 Dear all,<br>There will be a conference on marine biodiversity and ecosystem, that will<br>be held in Hong Kong in June 2015.<br>Abstract deadline is 27 Feb next month.<br>Details including invited speakers are shown in the email below.<br><br>Please join us if you are interested in!<br>Best,<br>Moriaki<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: become <become@hku.hk><br>Date: 2015-01-26 12:27 GMT+08:00<br>Subject: Second announcement: International Conference on Biodiversity,<br>Ecology and Conservation of Marine Ecosystems 2015<br>To: "moriakiyasuhara@gmail.com" <moriakiyasuhara@gmail.com> [...] Baban Ingole 2015-01-21T15:21:07+05:30 2015-01-21T15:21:07+05:30 Re: Workshop Introduction to Geometric Morphometrics, July 27-31, Barcelona, Spain https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;7a62ce53.1501 There is some thing wrong with dates is shows 2014? This time the course will be held at<br>> the beautiful rural house "Can Juli\ufffd\ufffd" (http://www.canjulia.org/?lang=en) ,<br>> in Barcelona province (Spain), with [...] soledad.esteban 2015-01-21T10:15:58+01:00 2015-01-21T10:15:58+01:00 Workshop Introduction to Geometric Morphometrics, July 27-31, Barcelona, Spain https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;f86d4d50.1501 Dear colleagues,<br><br>Registration is open for the course "INTRODUCTION TO GEOMETRIC MORPHOMETRICS-\ufffd\ufffd6\ufffd\ufffdth edition".\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>INSTRUCTORS: Prof. Chris Klingenberg (University of Manchester, UK) and Dr. Jes\ufffd\ufffds\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMarug\ufffd\ufffdn (UAM, Spain).\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Dates and Place: July 27-31, 2014.\ufffd\ufffdThis time the course will be held at the beautiful rural house "Can Juli\ufffd\ufffd"\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd(http://www.canjulia.org/?lang=en)\ufffd\ufffd, in Barcelona province\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd(Spain),\ufffd\ufffdwith option to stay there during the course (all-inclusive option).\ufffd\ufffd [...] Cassandra Rigby 2015-01-06T10:13:15+10:00 2015-01-06T10:13:15+10:00 Re: Small amendments to the DSBS constitution https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;cb3fda9c.1501 Dear all<br><br>As Treasurer of our small Oceania Chondrichthyan Society in Australia with only about 130 members, I can vouch for how much work is involved in administering paying members. It seems a justified and wise decision to appoint someone with that sole responsibility, to, as you say Chris, ensure volunteers are not unduly burdened. [...] Chris Yesson 2015-01-05T15:24:33+00:00 2015-01-05T15:24:33+00:00 Re: Small amendments to the DSBS constitution https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;42653817.1501 Dear Erik,<br><br>Given the initial interest shown in the society, we hoped that there would<br>be a sizeable membership.<br>For example, at the moment there are more than 250 subscribers to this<br>mailing list.<br>It was felt that managing a membership list with dozens and dozens of<br>members would be a significant undertaking, and that this task wasn't<br>outlined in any of the original 'job descriptions'.<br>Members of the board pointed out that many other societies had a designated<br>post of membership secretary and that it would be beneficial to have such a<br>post for our society. [...] Erik Cordes 2015-01-05T09:40:49-05:00 2015-01-05T09:40:49-05:00 Re: Small amendments to the DSBS constitution https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;7c3b216c.1501 Hi Chris (et al.),<br><br>It seems to me that since there is already a Treasurer, two Vice Presidents for Development, and there will be staffing for the conference(s) affiliated with the Society, that we might not need a separate \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMembership Secretary\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd position. However, I am also sure that the executive committee (or whatever you are called) has had a lot of discussion on this and has agreed that it is a good idea. Would it be possible for someone to share a bit more of the justification for this position before it is created? [...] Chris Yesson 2015-01-05T14:27:12+00:00 2015-01-05T14:27:12+00:00 Small amendments to the DSBS constitution https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;7eeb1bec.1501 Dear all,<br><br>We have two small amendments that we would like to make to the constitution<br>of the society, that require approval of its members.<br><br>The first is the creation of a membership secretary to manage the<br>administration involved with having paying members (we hope to have the<br>payment process in place very soon).<br>The second is to include a reduction in membership fees for those from<br>developing nations. We are currently working on a logo for the Deep-Sea Biology Society and want to include some deep-sea organisms.<br><br>If you have a vector file format image of a deep-sea animal that you wouldn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt mind sharing for use in the society logo (preferably available through a CC) please send it along to me. [...] Holly Bik 2014-12-04T14:31:12+00:00 2014-12-04T14:31:12+00:00 PhD Opportunity in Birmingham, UK - the 'Omics of oil spills https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DSBS;d5e4f7e8.1412 Dear Colleagues,<br><br>I wanted to bring to your attention a PhD opportunity in my group at the<br>University of Birmingham, UK - apologies for any cross-posting:<br><br>*Using \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdomic methods to determine how sediment communities of microbial<br>eukaryotes respond to oil spills and environmental disturbance* -<br>http://www.findaphd.com/search/ProjectDetails.aspx?PJID=59530&LID=124<br><br>The focus of the project would span both shallow-water and deep-sea<br>sediments, including natural hydrocarbon seeps and locations impacted by<br>the 2010 Deepwater Horizon oil spill. The project would be ideal for<br>candidates looking to develop skills in bioinformatics and computational<br>biology. [...]
